FuncDef: The reset vxlan statistics l3-mode command clears Layer 3 VXLAN traffic statistics.
CLIs: reset vxlan statistics l3-mode source <source-ip> peer <peer-ip> local-vni <vni-id>
reset vxlan statistics l3-mode source <source-ip> peer <peer-ip> remote-vni <vni-id>

ParaDef.Info:
Clears statistics about Layer 3 VXLAN traffic with a specified peer VTEP IP address.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Clears statistics about upstream Layer 3 VXLAN traffic with a local VNI.
-

Specifies the value of VNI ID.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 16777215.

Clears statistics about Layer 3 VXLAN traffic with a specified source VTEP IP address.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Clears statistics about downstream Layer 3 VXLAN traffic with a remote VNI.
-

Examples: <HUAWEI> reset vxlan statistics l3-mode source 1.1.1.1 peer 1.1.1.2 local-vni 1
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
Layer 3 VXLAN statistics can be collected. To clear the existing Layer 3 VXLAN statistics before collecting new statistics, run the reset vxlan statistics l3-mode command.
Precautions
Layer 3 VXLAN statistics will all be cleared and cannot restore in the following situations:
The reset vxlan statistics l3-mode command is run.The device is restarted, and VXLAN tunnels are deleted.
